verbs.description: overhie (third-person singular simple present overhies, present participle overhying, simple past and past participle overhied)

entries.meaning: (chiefly Scotland) To overtake; to catch up with. [from 15th c.]
examples: I disencumbered myself by main force, and fled, but he overhied me, knocked me down, and threatened, with dreadful oaths, to throw me from the cliff.
